business.headline: Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.

Stocks to watch today: Zee, DMart, IRFC, ITC, Bharti Airtel, Hero MotoCorpAs markets open today, several companies such as Zee, DMart, IRFC, ITC, Bharti Airtel, Hero MotoCorp are expected to grab attention due to key updates.

Budget 2025: Will Nirmala Sitharaman address TDS-TCS challenges? As Budget 2025-26 approaches, FICCI and industry bodies advocate simplifying TDS-TCS rates and tax processes to reduce complexity, boost compliance, and enhance taxpayer confidence.

Donald Trump's tariff threat: Top experts discuss what it means for IndiaIn an exclusive panel discussion with Rahul Kanwal, News Director at Aajtak & India Today, leading experts shared their insights on what Trump's tariff threats could mean for India's economy, especially after the recent GDP data.

Budget 2025: Mohandas Pai calls for revised tax slabs, relief for middle-classFormer Infosys CFO Mohandas Pai calls for Budget 2025 reforms to ease middle-class tax burdens, simplify slabs, resolve disputes, and boost spending.

Post office schemes' interest rates unchanged for January-March 2025. Check hereSmall savings schemes will continue to offer unchanged interest rates for the January-March 2025 period, ensuring investors can enjoy stable returns through the quarter.
Sensex, Nifty surge nearly 2% as auto stocks drive Dalal Street rally The Sensex climbed 1.8% to end at 79,943.71, while the Nifty gained 1.9% to close at 24,188.65.

New pension rules from 2025: Now collect EPS anywhere in IndiaFrom January 1, 2025, EPS pensioners can receive pensions from any bank branch nationwide under the new Centralized Pension Payment System.
How will Donald Trump's tariff threat impact the Indian economy?Adverse effects on the Indian economy and global trade tensions loom as Donald Trump is set for his second term as US President.

Indo Farm IPO Day 3: What latest GMP and subscription shows on final dayIndo Farm Equipment IPO GMP: By 2:13 pm on Thursday, the issue was subscribed over 150 times, showing the massive interest in the public issue.
Vodafone Idea likely to launch 5G broadband services in March: ReportVodafone Idea plans to introduce 5G with competitively priced plans that could be up to 15% cheaper at entry levels.
ITR filing: Maximise tax savings for FY 2024-25. Check investment optionsTaxpayers can maximise their tax savings for FY 2024-25 by investing in key exemptions before March 31, 2025.

Sensex rallies over 1,000 points: What's behind today's bull run?Stock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 988.99 points to 79,496.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 308.30 points to 308.30 as of 12:50 PM.

Explained: Why Eicher Motors share price rallied 7% todayEicher Motors share price: At 12:31 pm, the stock was trading 6.74% higher at Rs 5,214.85 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange, marking a significant jump in its market capitalisation to Rs 1.43 lakh crore.

Air India launches Wi-Fi service on select domestic flights. Check detailsAir India becomes the first airline within the country to offer in-flight Wi-Fi on domestic routes, starting January 1, 2025, with complimentary internet access for passengers.

Maruti Suzuki share price jumps over 4%. What's behind today's gain? Maruti Suzuki stock price: At 12:04 pm, the stock was trading 4.01% higher at Rs 11,671.55 on BSE, with a market capitalisation of Rs 3.67 lakh crore. This marks a significant rally, as the stock has climbed over 6% in the past two days

Missed income tax section 87A rebate? Here's your chance to claim it for FY 2023-24With updates to ITR forms underway, eligible taxpayers can claim Section 87A rebates through revised filings by the extended deadline of January 15, 2025.

Jai Corp share price plummets nearly 20% today. Here's why Jai Corp stock price:  The sharp drop comes after the company disclosed a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), in which it holds a 32% equity stake.
Explained: Why Bajaj Finance share price gained 4% in early tradeBajaj Finance stock price: At 11:05 am, it was the top gainer on the Sensex, up 3.74% to Rs 7,195.

Explained: Why RailTel share price gained 7% todayRailTel stock price: Despite today's rise, the stock remains well below its 52-week high of Rs 618, recorded on 12 July 2024. Over the past six months, RailTel's share price has fallen by 11%.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Cold wave sweeps North India, blinding fog in several citiesDelhi experienced its fifth consecutive day of a cold wave on Friday, with dense fog disrupting traffic and potentially impacting some flight operations.

He's been dropped: Mark Taylor slams Rohit Sharma's 'resting' antics at SCGFormer Australia cricketer Mark Taylor has slammed Team India's line of Rohit Sharma 'resting himself'. Speaking on Triple M Cricket, Taylor said that Rohit has been dropped, and the team should just simply say so.

New Orleans attacker hid bombs in ice coolers, had detonator in truck: BidenUS President Joe Biden said that the ISIS-inspired New Orleans attacker planted explosives in French Quarter before he rammed a crowd and opened fire, killing 15.

Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Trouble mounts on India as Kohli departsIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) 5th Test, Day 1 Live Updates, Reactions: Virat Kohli once again departed after getting set at the crease. They lost three wickets in the first session with KL Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill departing cheaply. Earlier, India won the toss and opted to bat first on a cloudy morning. India captain Rohit Sharma has decided to rest himself for the rest while Akash Deep has been ruled out due to injury.
Wi-Fi on Air India flights now: 5 things you might miss doing on planeOn January 1, Air India introduced complimentary internet access for passengers on select aircraft.

4 Gujarat Titans cricketers under scanner in Rs 450-crore chit fund scam: SourcesFour Gujarat Titans players are linked to the Rs 450-crore Ponzi scheme run by Bhupendrasinh Zala. Zala, now in custody. The CID is investigating to recover funds.

Justin Baldoni alleges Ryan Reynolds 'berated' him for 'fat-shaming' Blake LivelyJustin Baldoni has filed a libel lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing Ryan Reynolds of berating him over comments made about Blake Lively's weight. Baldoni claimed his comments were related to safety concerns and not intended as fat-shaming.

PM Modi sends 'chadar' to Ajmer Sharif for 'Urs' of Khwaja Moinuddin ChistiPrime Minister Narendra Modi presented a 'chadar' to Minorities Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju which would be offered on his behalf at the famous shrine of sufi saint Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti in Ajmer.

Our captain Rohit Sharma opted to 'rest', no selfishness in team: Jasprit BumrahIND vs AUS: Unselfish Rohit Sharma has opted to 'rest' himself from the SCG Test, said stand-in captain Jasprit Bumrah. Bumrah said that the Indian team was as united as ever and were trying to keep the positives in mind going into the final match of the series.
Jaipur cop's son ploughs Thar into people performing kirtan, mob vandalises carThe Sikh community was participating in a kirtan when the red Thar drove into it at high speed, officials said.

2 killed, 18 injured after small plane crashes into building in CaliforniaThe single-engine four-seat aircraft crashed through the rooftop of a commercial building in Southern California about a minute after take-off.

1 dead after Scorpio overturns as toll workers stone vehicle over unpaid feeA toll dispute on Rajasthan's NH-68 escalated when toll workers allegedly threw stones at a vehicle, causing it to overturn. A 22-year-old died, and two others were injured.

Ambulance in 10 minutes: Blinkit's latest launches in Gurugram todayEach ambulance is equipped with essential life-saving equipment, including oxygen cylinders, Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs), stretchers, monitors, suction machines, and critical emergency medications.

All Goa hotels full: Chief Minister says influencers sending wrong messageGoa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant addressed claims of tourists ditching Goa during festivals and slammed social media influencers for sending a wrong message about the state. He stressed that Goa was flooded with tourists at this time.

Virat Kohli out or not? Smith upset over third umpire's call in Sydney TestAustralia vs India, 5th Test: Virat Kohli was handed a lifeline when he was batting on 0 in the first innings of the final Test in Sydney. Steve Smith's effort in the slip cordon was deemed not out by third umpire Joel Wilson, leading to mixed reactions.

Video: Forest officials heroically rescue 600kg rhino calf, carry it on shouldersThe rhino calf, estimated to weigh between 600 and 700 kilograms, was carefully lifted onto a wooden plank and carried on the shoulders of the rescuers to safety.

With Love Meghan: Meghan Markle whips up delicacies for friends in Netflix showMeghan Markle stars in a new Netflix show, showcasing her daily life and culinary skills at her California home. The series, titled With Love, Meghan, will premiere on January 15, featuring Markle as both host and executive producer.

India, Bangladesh announce release of fishermen in each other's custodyAccording to the Centre, mutual exchange of fishermen and their vessels has been worked out with Bangladesh keeping in mind the primarily humanitarian and livelihood concerns of the fishing communities on both sides.

Border areas, remote villages in Ladakh gets 4G mobile connectivity: ArmyThe Army, in collaboration with private telecommunication companies, has successfully connected remote locations, including Galwan and Demchok, with 4G connectivity.

Secrets of Delhi's 700-year-old Malcha Mahal: Tughlaq legacy and royal tragedyA historic hunting lodge steeped in mystery, Malcha Mahal tells the tragic tale of royalty, loss, and unresolved legacies in modern India. Here's what we know about it.

Why Mahakumbh 2025 will be a digital spectacleThe upcoming mela has earned the moniker 'Digital Mahakumbh' as authorities leverage technology to the hilt to create a transformative experience for visitors

Fadnavis pauses predecessor's decision to ply rented state buses: SourcesMaharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has stayed the decision of the previous Eknath Shinde-led state government to hire buses on rent for the state's transport corporation after the Opposition alleged corruption in the process.

Cyber fraud called 'pig butchering scam' targeting unemployed youths: CentreThe pig butchering scam, which is believed to have started in China in 2016, targets gullible individuals with whom cyber criminals build trust over time, ultimately convincing them to invest in cryptocurrency or some other lucrative scheme when their money is stolen.

Proceeding against Google temporarily paused by Mumbai court in defamation caseThe case against Google stems from a complaint lodged by one Dhyan Foundation against the tech giant alleging violations linked to online content that they said was defamatory.

Baby John box office Day 9: Varun film earnings drop to Rs 1 crore in IndiaVarun Dhawan's Baby John is struggling at the box office, both domestically and internationally. The film's collections have dwindled, plummeting to just Rs 1 crore on Day 9.

Pushpa 2 box office Day 29: Allu Arjun film races past Rs 1,800 crore globallyPushpa 2 box office collection Day 29: Allu Arjun and director Sukumar's Pushpa 2: The Rule raked in over Rs 1,800 crore globally within a month.

The journey feels complete: Kartik Aaryan on Murlikant Petkar's Arjuna Award winChandu Champion actor Kartik Aaryan and director Kabir Khan celebrate para-swimmer Murlikant Petkar's Arjuna Award win, 50 years after his historic Paralympic gold.

SRK returns from Jamnagar after New Year bash, wears hoodie to avoid papsShah Rukh Khan and his family were seen returning to Mumbai from Jamnagar. The actor covered his face in a hoodie to avoid being photographed by the paparazzi.

sports.headline: Rohit Sharma has played his last Test for India: Sunil GavaskarIndia captain Rohit Sharma has played his last Test match in Melbourne, said Sunil Gavaskar on Friday - Day 1 of the final Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Sharma skipped the SCG Test after opting to rest himself.

Steve Smith '100 percent' certain he got his hand under Virat Kohli's catchSteven Smith is 100 percent certain he got his hand under the ball while attempting to catch Virat Kohli at slip on the first day of the SCG Test. The decision was referred to the TV umpire and was eventually ruled not out.

With speculation around Rohit Sharma's absence, the team seeks to silence critics and defend the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Will motivate me to work harder: Gukesh ecstatic after Khel Ratna honourD Gukesh was among the four athletes along with Manu Bhaker, Harmanpreet Singh and Praveen Kumar to be honoured with the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award.

India will not care about media stories ahead of Sydney Test: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar urged Team India to ignore media speculation about Rohit Sharma's potential exclusion and focus on the high-stakes Sydney Test, aiming to level the Border-Gavaskar Trophy and keep their World Test Championship hopes alive.

India are perfectly capable of a comeback in Sydney Test: Sunil GavaskarBorder Gavaskar Trophy: In an exclusive interview with India Today, former Indian cricketer Sunil Gavaskar backed India to make a strong comeback in the New Year's Test, starting January 3 at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

Can India win Sydney Test? History doesn't favour visitors Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: India have won only one out of 13 Test matches at the Sydney Cricket Ground. India lost the Adelaide and Melbourne Tests to trail 1-2 in the five-match series.

Can India rise above chaos and taste rare success in Sydney Test?Border Gavaskar Trophy, IND vs AUS: India have a point to prove in the Sydney Test with a place on the line for the World Test Championship Final. Rohit Sharma's fate in the purest might also be decided in the New Year's Test.

Dressing room leaks, Indian cricket's persistent plague, strikes againWhat happened in the dressing room hasn't stayed in the dressing room. Ahead of the much-awaited finale of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, the Indian cricket team has been rocked by off-field controversy. While the dressing room chaos has been ugly, it is not unprecedented.

Australia beautiful for travel, tough to tour: Watch Gambhir's Sydney speechGautam Gambhir inspired Team India with a motivational speech at the Australian Prime Minister's residence, emphasising resilience ahead of their must-win Sydney Test. Rohit unlikely for Sydney finale, Test retirement looms large: SourcesTeam India face the chance of a captaincy change in the Sydney Test, with Jasprit Bumrah looking likely to lead in Rohit Sharma's likely absence. The leadership switch adds intrigue to a must-win game as India battles to sustain their World Test Championship dream.

AUS vs IND, SCG Test Day 1 Weather: Will rain affect opening day?India faces a must-win Test at SCG to keep their World Test Championship hopes alive, battling inconsistent form, extreme weather, and Rohit Sharma's likely absence in a high-stakes decider against Australia.

Magnus Carlsen set to marry girlfriend Ella Victoria Malone: ReportsWorld No.1 chess player Magnus Carlsen is set to enter wedlock with 26-year-old Ella Victoria Malone. Carlsen recently shared the World Blitz Championship 2024 title with Russia's Ian Nepomniachtchi.

Rohit Sharma set to miss Sydney Test, may never play in whites again: SourcesAustralia vs India, 5th Test: Rohit Sharma may not find a place in the playing XI for the series finale, starting January 3 in Sydney. Pacer Aakash Deep will miss the fifth Test due to injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
